items.headline: Gaza ceasefire Phase 2 stalled: Negotiations for the second phase â€” intended to release all remaining hostages and end the war â€” were supposed to begin in February but have not materialized. Rafah crossing reopened with limited access last week.
All hostages from Phase 1 returned: Final deceased hostage Ran Gvili returned to Israel. Trump visited the Knesset celebrating the Phase 1 achievement, calling it 'the end of an age of terror.'

Appeals court upholds immigration detention policy: Federal court ruled that individuals arrested under immigration enforcement may be held in mandatory detention, reinforcing the administration's border security framework.
DNI Gabbard faces scrutiny over intelligence handling: Questions surrounding the handling of a sensitive intelligence intercept continue to generate discussion in Washington.
Big Tech AI capex forecast: $650B in 2026: Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft collectively plan staggering infrastructure spending, primarily on AI data centers and compute capacity.
Polymarket tracking China-Taiwan risk: Prediction markets actively pricing geopolitical scenarios including potential China-Taiwan conflict by end of 2026.
Anthropic launches Cowork AI legal tool â€” triggered $285B software stock selloff as investors priced in AI automation of legal work (contract review, NDA triage, compliance workflows).
Claude Opus 4.6 released â€” improved agentic coding, 1M context window, multi-agent task delegation in Claude Code. The model you're hearing this from right now.
Apple adds Anthropic + OpenAI agents to Xcode â€” agentic coding now built into Apple's IDE, supporting Claude Agent and OpenAI Codex.
Alphabet resets AI infrastructure bar â€” massive 2026 capex for Google DeepMind compute capacity and cloud customer demand.
